metadata.case_name: State of Kerala v. Cochin Coal Co. Ltd.

facts.text: The respondent-assessee was a non-resident dealer in Travancore-Cochin during the year 1955-56. The period concerned ends on September 4, 1955.
The assessee used to supply coal to consumers in Travancore-Cochin State which later became Kerala.

In reply to notice under s. 12(2)(b) of the Travancore-Cochin General Sales Tax Act, assessee stated that sales of coal to steamers arriving and berthed in Travancore-Cochin State waters were not taxable because goods were stored by steamers for consumption on the high seas.
Assessee did not question liability to pay tax on supplies to other consumers in Kerala.
On March 7, 1959, Sales Tax Officer, Circle 1, Mattancherry assessed respondent on turnover of Rs. 1,29,352/-.
Respondent appealed; Assistant Commissioner allowed appeal in part, reduced turnover to Rs. 69,407/- by omitting portion after 6th September 1955.

Further appeal to Sales Tax Appellate Tribunal disposed on January 2, 1962 in favour of assessee; held sales were inter-State sales not taxable per Kerala High Court in T.R.Cs. 1,2,3 of 1961 (14 STC 850); s.26(1)(b) as amended by s.13(ii) Act 12 of 1957 prohibited taxation after March 31, 1951.
Deputy Commissioner filed revision to Kerala High Court under s.15(1); question: Whether in light of amending Act 9 of 1962, Tribunal's finding correct? High Court rejected on August 16, 1963.

legal_issues.text: Whether sales tax was leviable on inter-State sales of coal to steamers up to September 4, 1955, in light of s.26 of Travancore-Cochin General Sales Tax Act, Central Act 7 of 1956, and related constitutional provisions.

Whether the question raised was: 'Whether in the light of the amending Act 9 of 1962 the finding of the Tribunal is correct?' Court reframed to: 'Whether in the light of the Sales Tax Laws Validation Act, 1956 (Central Act 7 of 1956) read with the Travancore-Cochin General Sales Tax Act as amended up to 1956, the finding of the Tribunal is correct?'

petitioner_arguments.text: Argued by Solicitor-General that High Court failed to construe effect of relevant statutes and apply prior Supreme Court decisions; Central Act 7 of 1956 validated taxation of inter-State sales between April 1, 1951 and September 6, 1955.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Central Act 7 of 1956; Sundararamier case; State of Kerala v. Cochin Coal Co. Ltd. (1961)

respondent_arguments.text: Sales to steamers not taxable as inter-State sales; per Tribunal and T.R.Cs. 1,2,3/1961, s.26(1)(b) as amended prohibited taxation after March 31, 1951; Act 9 of 1962 incompetent post-Constitution Sixth Amendment.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: s.26 Travancore-Cochin General Sales Tax Act; Act 12 of 1957; Act 9 of 1962; Constitution Sixth Amendment Act, 1956

court_reasoning.text: High Court erred; chronologically: Pre-Constitution Act XI of 1125 levied tax without inter-State exemption; s.26 inserted 1951 to align with Art.286; Bengal Immunity (1955) declared inter-State sales non-taxable absent Parliament provision; Central Act 7/1956 validated State taxes 1-4-1951 to 6-9-1955.
court_reasoning.key_observation: s.26 imposed ban lifted by Central Act 7/1956.

court_reasoning.text: Constitution Sixth Amendment 1956 shifted inter-State sales tax to Centre; Act 12/1957 prospective amendment to s.26; Sundararamier (1958) held similar s.22 Madras Act conditional legislation activated by Parliament; State of Kerala v. Cochin Coal (1961) overruled Kerala HC view on s.26.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Levy valid up to 4 Sep 1955; Act 12/1957 and Act 9/1962 not relevant as prospective.

holdings.text: Sales tax properly leviable by State of Kerala on transactions up to 4th September 1955; Tribunal finding incorrect.
Question reframed and answered in negative.

precedents_cited.case_name: Bengal Immunity Company Ltd. v. State of Bihar
precedents_cited.relevance: Held inter-State sales non-taxable absent Parliament provision, leading to Central Act 7/1956.

precedents_cited.case_name: M. P. V. Sundararamier Co. v. State of Andhra Pradesh
precedents_cited.relevance: s.22 Madras Act conditional legislation imposing tax on inter-State sales subject to Parliament authorisation.

precedents_cited.case_name: State of Kerala v. Cochin Coal Co. Ltd.
precedents_cited.relevance: Overruled Kerala HC on s.26; Validation Act 1956 enabled tax on inter-State sales.

precedents_cited.case_name: Cochin Coal Co. Ltd. v. State of Travancore-Cochin
precedents_cited.relevance: Kerala HC view on s.26 incorrect.
Held inter-State sales after 31 March 1951 not taxable post-Act 12/1957.

statutes_cited.name: Travancore-Cochin General Sales Tax Act, XI of 1125
statutes_cited.relevance: Imposed sales tax; s.26 banned inter-State tax post 31 Mar 1951 subject to Parliament; amended prospectively by Act 12/1957.

statutes_cited.name: Sales Tax Laws Validation Act, 1956
statutes_cited.relevance: Validated State taxes on inter-State sales from 1 Apr 1951 to 6 Sep 1955.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Regulated inter-State sales tax; post-1956 amendment, Centre competent.

statutes_cited.name: Travancore-Cochin General Sales Tax (Amendment) Act, 1957 (Act 12 of 1957)
statutes_cited.relevance: Amended s.26 prospectively; deleted exception clause.

statutes_cited.name: Travancore-Cochin General Sales Tax (Amendment) Act, 1962 (Act 9 of 1962)
statutes_cited.relevance: Sought to validate by changing date to 6 Sep 1955; State incompetent post-1956 amendment.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; question reframed and answered in negative; matter remitted to High Court to remit to Appellate Tribunal with Supreme Court's opinion.
outcome.relief_granted: Sales tax leviable on inter-State sales up to 4 Sep 1955; Tribunal finding reversed.

key_quotes.text: "The ban imposed by s. 26 of the General Sales Tax Act, 1125 having been lifted by the Central Sales Tax Validating Act, 1956, the State was competent to collect all taxes in respect of sales in the course of inter-State trade or commerce up to September 5, 1955."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on validity of tax levy.

key_quotes.text: "We allow the appeal and answer the question in the negative."
key_quotes.speaker: court
